tweet: @Arielle_Ivy Perhaps! But the lines seperating these 'conditions' were defined by neurotypicals, not neurodivergent ppl. There's also a lot of people who don't know they're autistic.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @drdevonprice @tattoosbyfreak If you have a formal diagnosis, have you read through it? Mine is so cringy. "She made eye-contact, then looked away." "She has some friends." "She nodded when I spoke."

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @Tec683 @dinkydemure Attention deficit is a bad name. It should really just be called excutative dysfunction. Hyperfocus is a part of that

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @CostumeMenageri Perhaps! My issues with seeing them as separate is that we don't see the way they interact. My excutative dysfunction makes it hard for me follow along in a convo, cancel out sounds around me, maintain relationships

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @drdevonprice @tattoosbyfreak Definitely. And why formal diagnosis fail so many people. They focus on what autistic people look like (lack of eye contact) not what we experience. And for many of us, we've learned to hide/change our behavior to adapt

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @CostumeMenageri Also then does executative dysfunction exist separately from social and sensory issues? I don't have the answers and it's fuzzy b/c autism is different for everyone

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @CostumeMenageri Yeah I'm the same way:) But then where is the line? Not all autistic people are very neat and orderly and can focus on one thing. Those are just the autistic people who have a lot of support around them to help them stick to a schedule.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @tattoosbyfreak Yes but that distinguishing factor was defined by neurotypical doctors who defined it by behaviors that were most visible and uncomfortable to them. Autistic people have not defined their own condition

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @CostumeMenageri Executive dysfunction that is :)

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @CostumeMenageri It's, of course, up for debate! Executive functioning is a core feature of autism tho. It's been noted as since the 30s. But for reasons it's generally ignored as a symptom of autism.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @Marijke_Vonk It's all connected/why is why I don't believe in separating these conditions into different disorders

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @Marijke_Vonk Absolutely! But I see social issues as the top layer with executative dysfunction and sensory issues (which is a result of my different processing symptom) as the reason I struggle to follow along in a conversation/read social cues/read numbers right to left.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @Marijke_Vonk Persistent deficits in social interactions a way to define autism was decided by neurotypical researchers half a century ago. They defined autism by behaviors they thought were weird, not what autistic people experience. A lot of us socialize differently but we may not struggle

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: The problem with seeing ADHD (executative functioning) sensory issues, dyslexia, and motor skills as separate conditions and not under the umbrella of autism is that we don't see the way they interact with each other

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @dinkydemure Yes but executive dysfunction is a core part of autism (which is basically ADHD). Neurotypicals decided to label autism as a social disorder when really brain difference that affects sensory, executive, and motor skills

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: If someone has ADHD, dyslexia, and sensory issues, aren't they just autistic? (aren't these all just symptoms of autism)

name: Reese Piper

tweet: @sextoyspolitics Yes but the article and title suggested that all sex workers are not entitled to a coronavirus aid. Most sex workers don't own a business - they're independent workers and thus these relief loans don't apply to them.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @lannadelgrey @JacqTheStripper @lannadelgrey Sex workers are not exempt from unemployment through the CARES ACT. Only exempt from accessing a business loan. Most sex workers do not own businesses. They're individual workers who can apply for unemployment.

New Yorkers if you're filing a new unemployment insurance claim, the day you should apply is based on the first letter of your last name:

A - F file on Monday
G - N file on Tuesday 
O - Z file on Wednesday

Missed your day? File on Thurs-Fri-Sat

https://t.co/ZhoeF5DYn6

name: Reese Piper

tweet: @commaficionado We can't turn away from the history of violence against nonspeaking autistics behind the term aspergers. I agree that its silly and cruel to criticize how ppl individually identify, but I do think we should question people who claim to speak for others

name: Reese Piper

tweet: This past week I spent hours researching therapists. When you're autistic, it's not a simple 'just get a therapist'. Most are clueless about autism and can do more harm than good. But I've decided to undergo a 12 week executative functioning coaching. I'm feeling so hopeful!

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: I was so much like Greta growing up. Fiercely opinionated, direct, and not interested in showing a tone of emotion on my face. My traits were not invisible but no one recognized autism.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Autistic girls are 4x less likely to get diagnosed. Researchers cite masking, say autistic girls are skilled at hiding their traits. While that's true for some, for a lot of girls like Greta their traits are front and center.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: The hate thrown on Greta shows that autistic women's traits are not invisible. Her directness, her passion for justice, her minimal facial expressions have all been noticed and criticized. But until now, they have not been seen as autistic.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: (2/2) "But misclassification also means that the door is open to a lot of people who cannot get hired elsewhere. Poor, mature, fat, disabled, and undocumented dancers, for example, may not make the cut if clubs put everyone on payroll."

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: (1/2) "Misclassification treats dancers as a commodity; the club is guaranteed a fee from every dancer and they don’t have to pay out employment benefits. Many clubs flood their floors with dancers, which can make it difficult to make money as there’s more competition."

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @babyshadyx @StripsEmily I hear that. Most nights I make more than enough to share it, but I've seen many friends go home with peanuts after tipping. And some clubs the fees are outrageous.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @StripsEmily If you don't tip the DJ in most clubs you will get fired. The fact that you get preferential treatment because you tip it's a system of privilege and its extemely classist. Many dances barely make enough to cover their fees.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @StripsEmily If you make enough where you can afford to tip out, consider yourself lucky. It's a privilege. And that's why I detest tipping out. It's a system designed to keep poor dancers poor.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @StripsEmily Because we are expected to tip out the DJ, the house mom, the waitresses, the managers, the doorman, and every other worker under the fucking moon, many dancers go home with less than 100 bucks. Tip culture keeps dancers poor.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @StripsEmily The idea that we 'owe' the DJ a chunk of our wages in order to get them to do their job is ridiculous and opens up so much room for shitty behavior. I once had a DJ demand that I suck his dick because I refused to tip him 20% of my wages.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @StripsEmily The tip culture in strip clubs is extremely exploitative, please don't condone it. Why are we responsible for the DJ's salary when we pay a house fee?

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: I believe my seizures are caused by repeated over-stimulation. They always happen during high stress periods & happened once on acid (which is definitely a period of over-stimulation). Autistic brains perceive more but can't shut off. My seizures have felt like a reset button

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Most people don't believe I'm autistic until I tell them about my lifetime of seizures. This medical problem is serious enough for people to then take my other problems seriously.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Fast forward 16 years when I started questioning autism, my best friend scoffed until he read that autistic people are more likely to have seizures than the general population. He witnessed me pass out and seize a few and was shocked that I didn't have an answer for them.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: For #epilepsyWeek I want to talk about how my seizures are my most 'visible' autistic trait. I started fainting and having seizures when I was 9. I saw a bunch of doctors, got an EKG, EEG, my thyroid checked, and was told over and over again that nothing was wrong with me.

name: Reese Piper

tweet: @sapiotextual Yes, but you had a kid! It's a miracle I leave the house with my nephew. There's so much you need to plan ahead with a baby

name: Reese Piper

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @PocketSpock47 @Autistic_Alice Agreed. I also think masking is too commonly only seen as acting. While it is, of course, part of it, non-white men have different social experiences and thus our autism expresses differently. I mask, for example, less to fit in, and more to manage my hyper-empathy

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: New Yorkers, I dare you to go one weekend without name dropping.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: It's so difficult to see our mothers as anything more than, well, our moms. Their lives before us and around us can at times feel irrelevant. But this week, the  80/90's babies watched a woman who could have been our mom bare her pain and break through generations of silence

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Many of our mothers were saddled with children and stuck in loveless sexist marriages where they pocketed their needs and their wounds festered. We take on their trauma in snap shots; only hearing bits of detail about the pain they endured; but it's present in the background

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: My mother was born in the 60's. While she was never a country club/prep school gal she was raised in a time where child abuse was brushed under the rug and marriage in your early 20's was the norm. My mother didn't reap the benefits of feminism nor was she given space to heal

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: It's taken a few days to process why the #KavanaughHearings have been so triggering for me. I'm not a victim of assault nor a victim of skepticism. But the trails paralyzed me because Dr. Ford is my mother's age and I couldn't help but feeling like I was watching my mom testify

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: My autistic and lesbian identities are intertwined by people’s desire to get rid of both groups. Whether it’s conversion therapy or applied behavioral analysis https://t.co/UBCSZ1mFvG

"My friends have had sex with strippers" 
"Is that why I always get hard around you?"

name: Reese Piper

name: Reese Piper

description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Very few feminist outlets covered the raids in NOLA because feminism has become a commodity. If you want to see change in the power dynamic between men and women you can start by taking that 200 dollar monthly fee to the Wing and putting it towards groups supporting working women

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: I'm disgusted by the lack of outrage after the article. Are we so desperate to network and to 'make it big' that we're willing to cheer for women being stripped of work?

name: Reese Piper

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Opening up a $200 a month work space on top of a former place of work for margnalized people is called gentrification @audreygelman. Will you fashion this Wing with a pole in full cultural appropriation garb? Or just host workshops on how dangerous it is for women to earn money? https://t.co/XAj7jh6717

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Autistics are the most caring, chaotic, and creative people I know. Our ability to see beyond categories is driving our world to a better place. We need neurodivergence now more than ever. #Endautismnow is sheer ignorance. Create hashtags for accomdations not eradication.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @evammiller07 Hi Eva! Thank you for your kind words about my article. Feel free to send me a DM and we can exchange contact details. Thanks!

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Want to encourage people to be connected in this world? Raise the minimum wage to 20 bucks an hour, fight for free healthcare and childcare, advocate against wars. I guarantee the results will be hordes of people that won't need to spend hundreds on mindfulness workshops

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: I fear all the mindfulness movement has accomplished is empower an already wealthy group of people to continue muting other people's suffering in order to exploit their labor

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: I appreciate a lot of what yoga/mindfullness/self-care has to offer but none of addresses social problems that cause sickness in the first place

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: If your encouraging people to mediate in order to manifest money than you're just feeding the system that wreaks havoc on our emotional well-being

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: I'm so disgusted by how money motivated the mindfulness/self-care movement is. People are disconnected and emotionally sick because we live in a capitalist society that forces people to shut down their needs in order to work and work and work to barely scrape by

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Just listened to an episode of Mind Love where a guest on the show told people they can manifest 30k a month by writing down their goals. Surely, people aren't that class blind to understand that isn't possible for most Americans?

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: "The capitalist reality is that not everyone can afford to meet their basic needs and where basic needs can be afforded, emotional intelligence cannot." @gbggrl https://t.co/XitqYxBJpF

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @Melodoinks I'm still figuring it all out, but for me, I need to put boundaries up with how much time I spend with people and who I spend time with. This article helped a lot https://t.co/jtYSnpqCd2

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet:
It’s an honor to have my words featured alongside so many amazing #actuallyautistic writers and I'm equally honored to breathe light into the experiences of autistic sex workers. Pledge the anthology below!!!!! #StimBook

 https://t.co/YKDysJPWgV https://t.co/bSrP8DxJ2a

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Sex work is different for everyone just as autism is different for everyone. My goal in my writing is to capture the ambiguity we walk around with every day so that people can find meaning in their lives. #StimBook

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: This last year, though, stripping has taken a toll on me. How is talking endlessly night after night affecting my growth? Can I grow into the compassionate autistic woman I want to while working in such an emotionally strenuous job? #StimBook

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: I wrote about how dancing taught me to read nonverbal cues and helped me connect in the article below, which captured my first 2 years in the industry. #StimBook https://t.co/OTJgER9Fnq https://t.co/kmAzUBG1BX

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Can I thrive in this inaccessible world as an autistic woman without sex work? #StimBook

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: In my article, I’ll be discussing how stripping helped me undo years of performance. Yes, it led me out the woods, but lately, I’ve been thinking that in order to develop an identity outside of dancing, I have to stop. But can I even quit? #StimBook

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Passing as non-aut is a performance that requires both 100% engagement and intellectual labor. It’s a strenuous game of theater that I perform day-after-day unconsciously. When I strip, though, one performance has to give. I can't be both stripper and non-autistic girl #StimBook

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Stripping has been both a blessing and a curse. It saved me from an abominable student loan and provided a comfortable lifestyle w/o having to work 40+ hours a week, but I can never switch off. Talking to customers sucks up all my energy and leaves me depleted. #StimBook

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: I’ve been stripping for about 3 years now, during which I discovered autism, starting writing personal essays and reporting on the industry. I enjoy writing about topics people experience in everyday life but don’t have the words to discuss them. #StimBook

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: I’m thrilled to be a part of the #StimBook, a collection of diverse autistic writing. Below is my thread talking a bit about me and my piece - a personal essay about sex work, performance, and autism.  https://t.co/YKDysJPWgV https://t.co/u1OEBG2oXG

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: "Many autistic traits are a result of being so in tune with other people’s energy that it literally hurts. Shutting down to others emotions and taking them on without discrimination are two sides of the same coin."

name: Reese Piper

tweet: "I wish that more people could understand hyper-empathy and how it impacts autistic people. We are often more sensitive to the energy and the emotions of the people around us. "@Briannon https://t.co/jtYSnpqCd2

tweet: Does anyone have any recs for severe pregnancy anxiety and depression (third trimester). Asking for a friend. Once a week therapy isn't enough at this point and I'm worried. Are there any centers with the round the clock care? Thank you!

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @MeowMissSnow Thanks!

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @ChelseaChavis Thanks babe. Miss you

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: But even with my autism being dissected, I'm happy to see so many people took the time to read my long ass article and talk about it. I guess hackers and strippers have a lot in common (P.S autistic men, come to the club, chances are you'll meet an autistic dancer)

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: So, if someone says they're autistic, whether they are self-diagnosed or not (also remember a diagnosis runs thousands of dollars), believe them. They know their lives better than you do. It's not a catchy phrase for people to label their eccentrics, it's a deeply felt difference

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Lastly, if you've worked with an autistic child, guess what you've met one autistic child. Autism is not a disease that habors in the body and manifest similarly in most people, it's a neurological difference that interacts with the world around us

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Many autistic people dip in and out of 'functioning' abilities. Today, I might be very 'high' functioning and tomorrow it may be a struggle to remember to take out my tampon. They are not static terms and our access to support shouldn't be defined by our ability to speak

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Moreover, high/low functioning are useless terms. I liked to see people move away from labeling autistic through their ability to verbalize. I'm grateful for my strong (ish) communication skills, but behind closed doors, I have seizures, go selectively mute, and can't organize

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: The diagnostic process and the public's understanding of autism don't account for learned behaviors. Yes, b/c of stripping I can read people, but I didn't learn naturally. So, just because someone can interact, don't dismiss their autism. You don't know what it took to get there

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Medical professionals have failed autistic people by basing the diagnostic system that based its entire understanding of autism from studies of white middle/ upper-class boys. Even when presented with glaring symptoms, women are less likely to be diagnosed and treated

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Today my article Secret Life of Autistic Stripper landed on Hacker News. I'm grateful and excited that it's making waves and getting people to discuss autism. But I'm not so thrilled about people debating whether I have autism or not

name: Reese Piper

tweet: Sex working mothers are at the front lines of a radical sexual politics, as these front lines begin in our own homes @sapiotextual https://t.co/RlYnnNeEY5

tweet: “Having the framework of autism boils down to not looking out to the world to see how I should exist, but knowing I don’t actually have to be social, " she says. “Because I also know that I understand things a lot deeper than a lot of people.” https://t.co/y2GDYxhOqQ

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: "I learned to showcase different parts of my persona based on the customer. It seemed practicing social skills paid off – I became a deft conversationalist, sometimes earning my night’s wage just from talking."

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: What I learned about myself and about "passing as non-autistic" after writing this is that we need to talk more about learned behaviors. I can socialize (and enjoy it), but it took work to get there. However, no one sees the effort, they only see the outcome

name: Reese Piper

tweet: My latest! On how stripping taught me to navigate this world as an autistic woman. Probably the most painful thing I've ever written, but I'm proud. Thank you to everyone who helped me with it #actuallyautistic #stripperproblems https://t.co/KUvvzDmpnp

tweet: I've said it before but it needs repeating. My abortion saved my life. And it seems it's going to be overturned. It's happening, regardless of how absurd it seems. Are there protest planning? #RoeVsWade

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: "Roe died of neglect. Centrists saw it as too polarizing to defend; leftists deemed it too safe to rally around; the media saw it as old news. Not enough people were out in the streets, screaming that Roe was in danger " https://t.co/m7yBGgQpPb

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @missamandapell So many strippers have to work double just to pay for them. No one understand the reality of what working for free means

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @Melodoinks Me too. Places and people that energize is a good window to understand when it's safe(ish) to be yourself or grow into our different masks

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: It's a wonderful campaign - masking as non-autistic is exhausting and I live with chronic fatigue because of it. I have to socialize intellectually and, as you can imagine, that's fucking hard, but masks are necessary sometimes. I need them in my life

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Also sorry for the lack of background info: #takethemaskoff is a campaign advising auties to be themselves. Many of us reduce stimming, pretend to enjoy eye-contact, pretend to listen when we can't understand, and/or don't wear our noise canceling headphones to appear normal

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: A better approach to dissecting the masks that many autistics wear to pass as NT could be talking about finding safe places to be yourself and of course learning when you're acting and when you're not. Without this conversation, it's just a privilege white take on autistic rights

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Masks are necessary sometimes. We need them to get jobs. To negotiate with car dealers. We need them to make sure we don't get taken advantage of.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Masks have helped me reduce bullying and rejection. Yes, they are exhausting and traumatizing, but not as traumatizing as being bullied. They have also helped me reduce assault and other forms of coercion.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Simply advising autistic people #takeoffthemask without safety info is dangerous. A black autistic boy could be at an increased risk for police violence for simply being himself. Masks are a survival tool

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: I've developed many masks over the years, some more enjoyable than others, and some that have been necessary for my safety. What's important I think is to know yourself enough to know when you're masking and when it's safe to be yourself

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: #takethemaskoff is a great campaign but is it too simple? If we've been camouflaging for years at what point do these masks just become part of who we are?

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @emclem__ @phani3star Whereas, if I told you I started stripping because I wanted an outlet to express myself (also the truth) it feeds into the narrative that stripping is empowering experience. Neither things represent the entire picture and you lose the crux of my experiences. Make sense?

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @emclem__ @phani3star What I don't like about this question is that forces us to chose between empowerment/victim narrative. Like, if you were interviewing me and I told you I started stripping b/c of my students (the truth) it feeds into the narrative that no one strips by choice

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @emclem__ @phani3star Thanks for asking! I would argue that most people don't get asked this question. No one asks a waitress why they started serving. While interviews featuring yoga instructors or lawyers sometimes broach why they got into their profession, it's never the main ingredient.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Strippers never asked each other "why did you start stripping?" Only editors, journalist, creepy customers, and judgmental friends do

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Sleep meds are vital to me. I don't sleep well as is, especially after work. I take gaba, kava kava (limit dosage of this) magneisum (in cream form), and cbd oil for sleep. I also wear an eye mask.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Try to smile and be positive and make money in the beginning of a shift and if your club lets you, go home and get sleep.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Working sober has never really been an option for me, especially when I'm in a bad mood. Try to limit the sugar in your drinks. Don't drink the cheap champagne. Mix alcohol with soda water, not soda.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: When I am tired I am more likely to turn to drugs. Coke is fun, but will fuck up your ability to work the next night (a line is prolly okay, but its never really a line is it?). Kratom is a cleaner and healthier alternative, but not legal in every state

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Make sure you're more vigiligant with your boundaries. Say no. For whatever reason when I'm tired and spent is when I am the most vulnerable for assault. People prey on negativity. It's fucked, but it's the world we live in

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: If possible, be more selective about your customers. Walk away from  toxic customers. They will burn you out even more and then affect your ability to make money for the rest of the night. Save your energy for a customer you like

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: If you're feeling burnt out and have to work be very selective about any activities you do outside of work. Right now, I'm bed ridden until 5pm and then get up to stretch and get ready for work. Don't overuse your brain in the day

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: I'm in the waves of autistic & sex worker burnout. This guide below has been super helpful. Below I have some tips that are helping me stay sane https://t.co/3i79eQdFSH

tweet: @NeuroRebel Silly. Most people don't have a choice to go to bed early (kids, school, work nights) and anxious people know they shouldn't stress over small details. We are anxious because we can't help it

name: Reese Piper

tweet: @onyx_akari @k8kateee Essentially, what I am speaking about is different. What I am referring to are articles and social media posts that reach the world and objectify the child's autism to highlight how strong the parent is - "like I am a better parent cause my child has autism" etc

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @onyx_akari Plus, a lot of parents share their childs diagnosis as a way to garner pity and attention (not all parents, but a lot of what i see on facebook is parents posting childs autism as a malady needing to be cured, not a gift)

name: Reese Piper

tweet: @onyx_akari In anonymous forums that's fine, but an autism diagnosis can be used against you (take away your children; prevent you from getting hired). Thus, it has to be the child's decision to put that information on the internet, not the parents

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Also the presense of a lot of women in the club disrupts the flow of money. Men will try to hit up civilian women (cause it's free). If you want to feel inspired, go see a theatre style show. Strippers have bills to pay

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Couples are even worse in my experience. They bring their drama to the club or pressure you to go home with them for no $. My job is not to spice up dull marriages for 40 bucks. Unless you plan on getting at least 3 dances, leave your partner at home. Don't waste our time

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Women customers should never be a sign of how progressive strip clubs are. Women come in, gawk at me on stage, criticize my apperance, touch me without consent, and even if they spend money expect way more than men in private rooms

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: The article by @Thrillist seems like a harmless portrayal of strip clubs, but it's anything but. Couples rarely spend more than 40 dollars, and as you can imagine that doesn't pay the bills. https://t.co/zmcZ1TK55q

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi

description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: This an extensive breakdown of how autism can occur in those socialized as girls. Very helpful! @dr_eprice  https://t.co/E1qtoHCT3B

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: This article was very helpful in helping discover autism @awnnetwork_ https://t.co/xQaurVh97e

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Autistics? What expressions of autism do you feel define your day to day lives?

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Researchers still believe autism naturally occurs more in boys than girls. I believe this disparity is the result of gross sexism and neglect. The consquence: women not discovering autism until they're well into adulthood

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Autism interacts with gender socialization and the world around us. It doesn't exist in a vacum which is why no autistic person is the same. It's a shame the diagnosis process isn't tailored for these differences

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Lack of eye contact often gets brought up as a sign of autism. For me, I enjoy eye contact if I feel safe and not judged. At work, I can make very intense eye contact if I trust the guy. Eye contact is a connection to my instincts

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Face blindless also is very common: Not being able to remember someone by their face. I'll meet people and then forgot we met unless we made an intimate connection

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: To add a few things I fogot: Insomnia is common amomg autistics. It's hard for to shut off our over active brains that process information differently. I've struggled with sleep my whole life

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @ShieldingC Yes, im the same. I only make money if im into them

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Lastly, I believe many of us are sex workers because traditional work is not possible or because we prefer to work in informal work. I hope to inspire more people to see the connection between sex work and autism

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Another article I read said autistics think perceptually instead of categorially which explains why so many of us are gender queer or bisexual. Gender and sexuality are not natually contained. Autistics see them for what they are

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: One article I read said autistics socailize intellectually, not naturally as a non autistic person does, thus making some of us skilled actresses. Before interviews or meeting someone new I obssesively rehearse my lines

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: A lot of autistic people have ADHD & Ehlers Danos. I would suggest that those conditions/differences may even just be a part of autism, not seperate conditions. But that's up for debate

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Seizures are very commom among autistics or veritgo or fainting. I lose my perpherial vision right before a seizure and I suspect I have mini ones in my sleep

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: I can't just casually learn something. I have to learn everything about a topic. It will consume my thoughts. Which is why I know a lot about a few things and nothing about other topics that most people have base knowledge of

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Autistics have tailored or 'special interests'. Topics that can consume your thoughts. Often women have special interests that don't raise eyebrows, like makeup or reading. But what makes it autism is the extent of the interest - it becomes all encompassing

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: I can't count change (only 20s now cause of stripping lol). I make lots of typos and spelling mistakes because I am dyslexic - which is connected to autism

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: What does this look like? I'm messy, clumsy, can't switch between tasks, have terrible hearing, and occasionally go mute or mix up my words

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Autism can be described as differences in excutative functioning, motor skills, and sensory skills, as well as differences in communication and social skills (but the last two are emphasized too much, and the 1st 3 are not brought up enough)

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: A lot of people reach out to me asking about autism because they suspect they might be on the spectrum too. No autistic person is the same, but below is a thread of different expressions and common co-occuring conditions

tweet: @_lzlm_ You can do more than you think. We're idea people that do well with good editors:)

name: Reese Piper

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: My abortion was not a life changing decision, but it did save me from an abusive man. There is not a day that goes by that I regret my choice. If you oppose abortion, just like if you oppose sex work, you don't live in reality

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi

name: Reese Piper

name: Reese Piper

tweet: Quote from a comment: (1/2)"She's scapegoating an entire industry for her mental compacity problems stemming from childhood and an abusive relationship. She blames the industry instead of taking responsibility for her own actions."

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Quote from a comment: "There’s already such a bad stigma, just because someone had an awful experience doesn’t mean everyone does. This job is not for everyone, but don’t make this out to be something it’s not."

name: Reese Piper

tweet: @prufrockprep We build rapid resistance to melatonin. They will work for 2 weeks or so, but then stop. Sleep issues affected much of my early twenties and made me more susceptible to seizures. name: Reese Piper

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @BubblyCarissa @theJaybrody @madiereneexo I think it's fine to tip who you want to tip. Just don't come in and don't tip at all.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @theJaybrody @madiereneexo I'm not advocating for customers to tip everyone or immediately drop money, I just don't like groups of men coming into the club who are there just hanging & not spending money, all the while watching gawking at the stage. It makes it a really difficult space to earn a living in

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @theJaybrody @madiereneexo I get it from a customer's POV. I've been a customer in a strip club and I didn't want to feel like dropping 50 bucks when I walked through the door, but tipping on stage when sitting & not monopolizing a dancer's time when you have no intention of paying are important

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @SexyIronMachine This is the emotional aspect of the job that can go uncompensated. Or alternatively it can very compensated in a champagne room, but I think a lot of customers expect it for free

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @SexyIronMachine The conversational exchange is often not equal (which is completely fine, I don't want customers knowing my 'real' self). But a lot of the emotional 'labor' is keeping the mood positive, asking interesting but not too serious questions, remembering details of their lives

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @SexyIronMachine Ya, its a bit easier to monetize a dance than emotional labor. I knew a dancer saturday night that was paid 400 to talk and hang out and drink all night and was happy. That may seem like a lot, but it was over 4 hour period.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @SexyIronMachine I adore my customers who tip generously but talking can be more draining then dancing sometimes. I enjoy the labor, but it feels nice to be compensated for it

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @SexyIronMachine If you're interested in chatting with a dancer for awhile, I would pay her the equalivant of what you would pay for that time in dances.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @SexyIronMachine Depends on how long you've been talking. If you've been talking for 15 -20 mins, but you're not interested in proceeding with a certain dancer, 20-40 dollars is okay with "nice chatting to you, but I just want to chill for a bit, or I am waiting for so and so"

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @SexyIronMachine When I go to a club as a patron I say no to dancers. But I make sure to tip appropriately at the stage or when I've been chatting up a dancer for awhile. Jacq the stripper has a really good book called how to be a feminist in a strip club which I think is helpful for customers

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @SexyIronMachine Saying I'm waiting for so and so is fine in my opinion. You're spending your money and you should spend it on the dancer you want to spend time with :)

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @SexyIronMachine It's completely acceptable to say no to a dancer your are not interested in. Rejection is part of the job. My issue is more with people coming in who have no intention of spending or who talk to a dancer for over 15 minutes and then refuse to tip or go for a dance.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @hottorontoguy @giajordan @AllysaJaydenxox This is how some of the strip clubs back in the day used to be designed tho in fairness. A lot of burlesque shows do this now. And in a way, it's not that different than church.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @alendrel The girls were good. They were complimenting my hair and bag. I felt so flattered.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @crispy__cameron @pinkasspanther When you walk into a club and talk to dancers, you are already ordering from the menu. Talking is part of our job and should be compensated. You wouldn't walk into a restaurant, order an appetizer, and then refuse to pay.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @pleasant_danger A simple few bucks on stage makes all the difference too (altho I don't recommend only going with a few bucks) but it's the principle. Men spend 5 dollars on coffee but moan over having to tip naked women.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @madiereneexo @theJaybrody Yeah - exactly.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @theJaybrody @madiereneexo Where theft comes in is when there a direct consumption of labor. Sitting down on the stage and maybe interacting with a dancer, talking with a stripper, drinking with her is all parts of our job that often go unpaid b/c customers don't value emotional and performative labor

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @theJaybrody @madiereneexo Many clubs don't have admission & some have same price beers as a bar, but, yes, some have exorbitant covers & 25$ blue moons. As a customer, I think it's fair to feel that includes watching a dance from afar, as well as getting to be in a space with semi-naked dolled up women

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @jtruant666 Asking singular questions to back me into a corner to prove your point is an abuse tactic. So I will leave this for now.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @jtruant666 Theft comes into play when you enjoy & consume labor w/o paying (talking, watching performance). I get that in sales a little bit of free labor is important to coax along a bigger sale, but some customers will sit at the stage all night w/o tipping. That is theft.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @jtruant666 You are not removed from our labor rights as a customers. By sitting down and feeling you have a right to enjoy strippers labor without paying, knowing full well that she doesn't get paid a wage you become part of the system that steals from strippers.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @hottorontoguy @AllysaJaydenxox Agreed - some customers do enjoy aggressiveness tho. But that's another conversation

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @hottorontoguy @AllysaJaydenxox I understand from your point of view. But you're refusing to see it from ours. You as a customer can make stripping 100% easier by simply paying just 1 dollar, which in turn will make your experience in clubs better since dancers are less frustrated and hostile

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @jtruant666 Because the shop assistant is still getting paid a wage. I on the other hand am working in the negative. I have to pay 60+ dollars to work.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @jtruant666 But when you consume labor by talking to us or watching us on stage intently (which is strippers labor and how we get paid) it becomes theft

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @jtruant666 I don't think you understand what emotional labor is and that sex work is indeed work. Theft comes into play when you consume labor and don't pay. So if you walk into a club, have a beer, keep to yourself, walk out 5 minutes later, okay so be it. Not theft, altho annoying.

name: Reese Piper

tweet: @hottorontoguy @AllysaJaydenxox New York is a very hard place to be a stripper. The Manhattan clubs cost 130+ to work

tweet: @hottorontoguy @AllysaJaydenxox Try to understand what it must feel like to be stared out and dance naked and no one tip you. Demanding tip gives back some of the power

name: Reese Piper

tweet: Lastly, many Autistics (not all, but many) struggles with organization, cleanliness, being on time,etc. To some this is a disability, to others, this is a byproduct of a live in the moment perception. Either way, executive functioning should be recognized as a part of autism

name: Reese Piper

tweet: Every Autistic person is different. Autism is nothing to be ashamed of. Your different way of connecting with the world is a gift to this earth. Our non-categorical perception fosters compassion and sees through oppressive social structures (gender, sexuality). We are the future

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Autism is not a social disorder. Autistics have a different way of communicating that is labeled as abnormal by nonautistic people (neurotypicals). There are many forms of communication that autistics are masters in (for example: reading and understanding other people energy)

name: Reese Piper

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: This signifies that we are employees, not IC. And managers are not only violating our IC status by not paying us a wage, but are operating outside of labor laws. If we're IC, then they are not accountable for unsafe work conditions

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: This varies between clubs, but many  managers mandate 7 hour shifts or fine you if you want to leave early. Some even force you to work a certain amount a shifts per week, enforce a dress code, and refuse to let you charge more than 20 dollars per dance (in US)

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi

tweet: @epballou I relate a lot to this. I communicate on an energy level with people. And some people I can chatter for hours back and forth and others it's like pulling teeth to understand a few sentences, but I always chalk it up to energy b/w us.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @epballou Yes, me too. I definitely have delayed reactions in convo - especially when I am nervous or uncomfortable. By could that be lumped into executive functioning? Which if deficit can make it hard to follow a sequence in a conversation, or is it just words, not convo?

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @epballou What is think by speaking? Like being able to think and speak at the same time? Like not needing to rehearse?

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @epballou I agree, but I think maybe that could be a product of sensory differences. My language is impaired b/c I have bad hearing b/c I can't drown out other sounds during conversation...idk what do you think?

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Despite assumptions, the 3 pillars of Autism are not repetitive behavior, social and language difficulties. That is just how the world sees us. Rather, Autism is defined by differences in sensory abilities, executive functioning, and motor skills #ActuallyAutistic

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Sexism isn't the only form of oppression. White feminists need to start understanding that.

tweet: @thedarkestskyy @NSFW_Sadie Also for many people who dip in and out of the industry, the phrase may not work for them. But.....identifying as a sex worker you acknowledge the stigma, and you if don't identify you may not face the risks associated with the jobs under the umbrella

name: Reese Piper

tweet: @MIdancer7 @StripperUnion @MclarenSadie I just don't see how blaming and shaming anyone changes anything - has it decreased extras at your club?

name: Reese Piper

tweet: @StripperUnion @MclarenSadie @MIdancer7 Blaming and shaming dancers for extras isn't going to stop dancers from providing extras. All it's going to do is create a more hostile work environment. Having management enforce no sex policy with cameras might be a better start

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @StripperUnion @MclarenSadie @MIdancer7 If a public conversation is going to happen about extras and if we want our jobs to entail just dancing then we need to also evaluate criminalization of prostitution, massage parlor raids, eros shutdown, management neglect and abuse, and dancer relationships with each other

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @StripperUnion @MclarenSadie @MIdancer7 But in an extremely criminalized and invisible industry to place an entire blame on the worker who has no labor protections erases an opportunity to advocate for reform in a way that can benefit everyone

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @ljtost @this_are_are @WordTheGreat That's exactly what it did for me!

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @ljtost @this_are_are @WordTheGreat I know, it's difficult to process, but I think there is beauty in being Autistic. My life is definitely harder than say my NT siblings, but I truly believe it's a higher state of consciousness

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @ljtost @this_are_are @WordTheGreat Ya that's what I thought when I thought maybe I had ADHD after my friend mentioned Autism - medication helped (just a bit) but it also made me more obsessive which is how I knew it was Autism

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @ljtost @this_are_are @WordTheGreat But even then it's complicated - the article below helped me understand that my difficulties stemmed from Autism and not ADHD. Hope this all helps! https://t.co/BfTAYCJgFJ

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @ljtost @this_are_are @WordTheGreat A big sign that maybe it's autism and not ADHD (or both) is the presence of an intense fear of saying the wrong thing and the overall feeling that you are different than the people around you, even if you are extroverted

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @ljtost @this_are_are @WordTheGreat Autism can be categorized by differences in executive, sensory, and motor abilities that can affect how we socialize and communicate with the world. I know ADHD shares these differences too which makes it difficult to pull them apart

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @ljtost @this_are_are @WordTheGreat I'm glad you liked the article. ADHD & Autism are sister disorders and share many of the same traits - some might even say that ADHD is a  spectrum condition. What makes Autism unique tho is the presence of special interests or 'obsession' with one topic - a tailored interest

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @NicoleLaneXo this warms my heart

name: Reese Piper

tweet: It's been said before but it's important: if you shame or attack sex work you attack sex workers. Our lives are intimately connected to our work and spewing hate against facets of our industry does nothing but make my life harder

name: Reese Piper

tweet: Some autistic parents express shock & disgust that other autistic moms consider hiring sex workers for their sons. The irony is that many sex workers are autistic themselves. Strip clubs, in a way, can be meeting places for #ActuallyAutistic

tweet: @AisjaMahmood but I have special interests and social hangovers even tho I am very extroverted. But I don't always feel like I am 'putting on a mask' as some autistic people have said they use in social settings. I very much socialize as myself - but I just need to be well-rested for it

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @AisjaMahmood Thanks for explaining - I can definitely relate to a lot of that! For me, ADHD symptoms popped up into my life after trauma and pressure of daily life became harder. I have so many of characteristics; reckless, blank out of convo, difficulty focusing

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @AshtheTabbyCat mild is horeshit! it diminishes that daily struggle and how it changes. Some days are harder than others

tweet: @peep_cast @FckshameProject ah thank you for this! so much love to you both

name: Reese Piper

name: Reese Piper

name: Reese Piper

tweet: @gigatcha Yes, 100%. My point was that we are compensated and valued (at work with our customers) for our sexuality and that is a privilege not given to non-sex workers. But, of course, it's not that simple. We get shamed by other dancers and management, etc

tweet: @AisjaMahmood How do they play out for you? (if you don't mind me asking). I think I have both, but I am unsure if my ADHD is just Autism.

name: Reese Piper

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Your boyfriend's calloused and shitty behavior is not b/c he "might be autistic". He's ignoring your concerns b/c he was raised to think that women's issues are not real. Please don't ever blame sexism on autism. #ActuallyAutistic

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Autistic parents talk over the autistic community the same way radfems treat sex workers  #actuallyautistic #autisticsstripper #sexwork

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @HBabyKC1991 @HappyHarlotxo Very true! thanks for your input. I didn't think about the review sites

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: @epballou Yes! Very true! Our executive, sensory, and motor difficulties are the reason for our social differences. They are not just byproducts of autism - they are autism.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Okay - hope that made sense! Comments appreciated!

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: By saying 'well why didn't she think about ADHD' diminishes my agency to understand my own brain. And it takes the conversation away autism and EF which needs to be happening

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: This is why I don't focus on ADHD in my writing about autism and executive differences. EF is a major struggle for many autistics and this is the unspoken story.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Both ADHD and autism should be assessed equally when seeking help, but they won't be, not when you are a woman who presents neurotypical. Most likely autism will never be mentioned by a professional

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: This is the reason why I didn't include this anecdote in my article b/c I do not want to promote 'you might have ADHD, try medication, okay that's not working, maybe you have autism' narrative b/c giving stimulants to some autistic people can make them suicidal

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: When I told my doctor this he just wanted to try more medication. At no point was autism suggested, even after I told him I have obsessive thoughts. I had to discover that many autistic people struggle with organization on my own

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: One reader was shocked that I didn't rule out a ADHD diagnosis. I did, in fact, consider and tried stimulants to improve my organizational woes. Unsurprisingly, they turned my already stimulated brain into a depressed anxious mayhem.

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: The problem is that these struggles often get lumped into ADHD and rarely raise a flag for autism. I don't know the % of executive difficulties in each condition, but even the research out there may be baised b/c so much of Autism research is focused on social aspects

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Both ADHD and Autism (and other conditions) share difficulty with executive abilities. This manifest into missing appointments, not being able to switch tasks, feeling overwhelmed by the thought of cleaning, unable to organize, etc

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: One of the biggest criticism I got for my recent autism piece on executive functioning (EF) was that I didn't mention ADHD. I'm happy to get criticism & feedback so thank you!  But this is something I want to address

name: Reese Piper

name: Reese Piper
description: Freelance writer, stripper • #ActuallyAutistic •  Working on a memoir •  Rep’d @mina_hamedi
tweet: Difficulty adapting to daily life is not a symptom often factored into the diagnostic process for autism. It should be https://t.co/glsDa3kU3L

name: Reese Piper

tweet: Sex work is so up and down. I don't just mean money, but emotionally too. Take breaks. Drink water. Build relationships.

name: Reese Piper
